report_title: Industry Report on Glasses and Contact Lens Manufacturing
executive_summary: While consumers have increased expenditures on glasses and contacts, competitively priced imports have increasingly met consumer demand, leading to revenue volatility for domestic manufacturers. And even though imports and exports stalled during the pandemic, import penetration expanded in 2021. Rising per capita disposable income, a growing adult population and improved insurance coverage have helped mitigate some of this volatility and bolster US manufacturers' demand. Meanwhile, new work-from-home norms and increased screen time have driven a higher need for corrective eyewear and contact lenses, supporting industry-wide revenue growing at a CAGR of 0.5%, expected to reach $8.4 billion in 2024. This growth includes a projected 1.3% increase in 2024 alone, where profit will remain on a growth trend, accounting for 8.6% of revenue.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: The Balance of Imports to Exports Shifted
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Imported glasses and lenses, which have become increasingly affordable and appealing to domestic consumers, have been increasingly satisfying the heightened demand for glasses and lens products.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Manufacturers Invest in Research and Development to Remain Competitive in the Contact Lens Field
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Manufacturers have invested heavily in research and development to prevent the commoditization of glasses and contact lens products.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: BOTH A MEDICAL NECESSITIES AND LUXURY ITEM KEEP DEMAND AFLOAT
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The cost of optometry services influences the number of people who visit the optometrist and the frequency of their visits, affecting demand for ophthalmic products.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: MANUFACTURERS ARE EXPECTED TO CONTINUE TO BENEFIT FROM THE NONDISCRETIONARY NATURE OF CORRECTIVE LENSES
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Consumers often become lifelong users of ophthalmic products once they start using corrective lenses.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: EMERGING INNOVATIONS IN CONTACT LENS RESEARCH AND DEVELOPMENT WILL BOOST QUALITY AND SPUR DEMAND
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Researchers are developing lenses integrated with microelectronics to monitor health metrics like glucose levels.
Companies are exploring Augmented Reality (AR) contact lenses capable of overlaying digital information onto the user's field of view.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Barriers to Entry and Increasing Concentration Support Profit
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: All products must be FDA-approved before use within the US.

industry_definition: This industry manufactures ophthalmic goods, including prescription eyeglasses, contact lenses, sunglasses, eyeglass frames, and protective eyewear.

threats: Number of people with private health insurance

key_trends: Manufacturers compete on both price and quality. They invest heavily in R&D to innovate new products.
Foreign manufacturers pose a significant threat to the industry.
An aging population and rising disease incidence fuel the demand for eye health products.

market_segmentation.segment_description: This market segment includes optometrists and ophthalmologists.
Optical retail chains offer corrective lenses through well-known outlets.
The rising popularity of online purchasing has led to showrooming.

products_and_services.product_description: This segment focuses on single-vision ophthalmic plastic lenses.
This segment includes multifocal ophthalmic plastic lenses.

tier_1_suppliers: Tool & Hardware Wholesaling in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_description: A drop in the trade-weighted index signifies that the dollar is losing value.

international_trade_points.trade_description: Some importers share of domestic demand are declining.

international_trade_points.trade_title: Imports satisfy demand for high-end and affordable products
international_trade_points.trade_description: Imports increased as domestic consumers with rising disposable income demanded discretionary products.

business_locations.location_description: The Southeast serves as a key manufacturing hub.
The West drives technological innovation in eyewear.

regulations_points.regulation_description: The QSR obligates manufacturers to focus on quality management systems.

basis_points.basis_description: Manufacturers compete on both price and quality.

concentration_points.concentration_description: Manufacturers' focus is on increasing economies of scale.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Manufacturers Face Steady Yet Fluctuating Purchases Costs
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Manufacturers must purchase various optical tools, machinery.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: Manufacturing requires significant capital investment in machinery.

volatility_points.volatility_title: Fluctuations in Export Value Drive Revenue Volatility
volatility_points.volatility_description: The primary source of industry revenue volatility lies in changes to export values.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: Virtual Reality Contact Lenses and Smart Eyewear Not Yet in Complete Focus
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Mojo Vision first developed virtual reality contact lenses.

FAQs.question: Does your company specialize in a niche or do you produce a diversified range of products?
FAQs.answer: In response to intense price-based import competition, many companies within the industry have specialized in higher value-added products.
